#	World	WLD	Population, total	SP.POP.TOTL

#	Sub-Saharan Africa	SSF	Energy use (kg of oil equivalent per capita)	EG.USE.PCAP.KG.OE

#	North America	NAC	Energy use (kg of oil equivalent per capita)	EG.USE.PCAP.KG.OE																																								
#	Middle East & North Africa	MEA	Population, total	SP.POP.TOTL																																								
#	Middle East & North Africa	MEA	Energy use (kg of oil equivalent per capita)	EG.USE.PCAP.KG.OE																																								
#	Latin America & Caribbean	LCN	Population, total	SP.POP.TOTL																																								
#	Latin America & Caribbean	LCN	Energy use (kg of oil equivalent per capita)	EG.USE.PCAP.KG.OE																																								
#	Europe & Central Asia	ECS	Population, total	SP.POP.TOTL																																								
#	Europe & Central Asia	ECS	Energy use (kg of oil equivalent per capita)	EG.USE.PCAP.KG.OE																																								
#	East Asia & Pacific	EAS	Population, total	SP.POP.TOTL																																								
#	East Asia & Pacific	EAS	Energy use (kg of oil equivalent per capita)	EG.USE.PCAP.KG.OE
#	Australia	Population, total	SP.POP.TOTL	Australia	AUS

### The data above was taken from http://databank.worldbank.org/data/reports.aspx?source=world-development-indicators#
### The data chosen was "population total" and "energy use per capita (kg Oil)". Then these two values are multiplied to get a total energy consumption in this area.
### Look at the metadata to define the areas
### Some small countries are missing, which is why the sum of the values doesn't perfectly fit to the world aggregate values (from 1990)
##### Note: Before 1990 there was no ECS (europe and central Asia) data. Therefore i calculated this from the world statistic and the numbers of the other areas. 
##### Note: There's a huge step for 1990 probably because Sowjet energy consumption wasn't known before by the world bank. Therefore just assumed??
